intro: Ruellia praeclara, commonly known as the showy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Ruellia praeclara is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
